title: Disposal of stocks of paddy purchased by the Paddy Marketing Board during the Maha Season 2014/15 and Yala Season 2015
decision_details: - Since the paddy purchasing programme for Maha Season 2015/16 has to be commenced at the end of this month, to arrange the necessary storage facilities for the purpose, it is essential to expeditiously dispose the existing paddy stocks collected in the stores.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Prime Minister, Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, on the recommendation of the Cabinet Committee on Economic Management and the decision taken by the Cabinet Sub?Committee on Cost of Living, to authorize the Paddy Marketing Board to keep 54,000 Metric Tons of Nadu paddy as a buffer stock and to immediately sell the remaining 264,180 Metric Tons of Nadu Paddy and the joint proposal made by Hon. Malik Samarawickrema, the Minister of Development Strategies and International Trade; and Hon. P. Harison, the Minister of Rural Economy  in relevance to the above proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister, was approved by the Cabinet.
